definition: to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: The papal captain have vainly endeavoured to induce his wife to remain behind him .
sentences.chinese: 教廷的隊長曾白費力氣地試圖說服妻子留下不去。

sentences.english: Despite all my efforts to persuade him, he wouldn't agree.
sentences.chinese: 儘管我盡力說服他，可他就是不同意。

sentences.english: Don't let the devil convince you otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓魔鬼用別的方式說服你。

sentences.english: I lurk at the end of the queue and persuade him to go for coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我悄悄跟在隊伍的末尾並說服了他出去喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Dissenters must be consistent, though, otherwise they'll fail to convince the majority.
sentences.chinese: 反對者必須堅持一致，否則就不能成功說服大多數人。

sentences.english: A defense lawyer says Jufer was intoxicated at the time of his crime.
sentences.chinese: 律師以他那富有感染力的辯護說服了陪審團。

sentences.english: Flattery is the best persuader of people.
The 'what if' device is often facile, rarely convincing.
sentences.chinese: “假如”式分析方法常常是膚淺的，很少有說服力。

sentences.english: She tried to convince the woman to wait for the police.
sentences.chinese: 她開始嘗試說服那個女人跟她一起等警察來。

sentences.english: People who are perceived as experts have a greater ability to persuade others.
sentences.chinese: 被冠以專家名號的人物在說服他人方面確實技高一籌。

sentences.english: Eagleburger says the U. S. can try to persuade the North Koreans to come back to the negotiating table.
sentences.chinese: 伊格爾伯格說，美國有能力試圖說服北韓重返談判桌。

sentences.english: She persuaded me into buying it.
Mitchell failed Tuesday to persuade Mr. Abbas to engage in direct talks with Israel.
sentences.chinese: 米切爾星期二沒能說服阿巴斯與以色列開展直接對話。

sentences.english: Chinese policeman tries to convince a knife-wielding man to release a hostage on a street in Guangzhou, China.
sentences.chinese: 警察試圖說服揮舞刀具的男子釋放人質。

sentences.english: Sometimes salesmen need to do a lot of fast talking to convince clients to buy.
sentences.chinese: 有時候業務員需要快言快語去說服客戶購買。

sentences.english: Of the modes of persuasion furnished by the spoken word there are three kinds.
sentences.chinese: 使用語言的說服性論證共有三種類型。

definition: to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to join/to connect/to link up/to communicate
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
